title: The Gilded Tapestry: Blood, Feathers, and Iron
tagline: In the fever dream of America's becoming, creation and destruction were the same furious act.
themes: Documentation as Both Preservation and Theft
The Ghost-Limb of the Civil War

chapters.title: The Ballroom Measured for Three Hundred

story: Write a chapter from the perspective of the shipping agent with the waxed mustache, detailing the strange cargo he's seen cross the country.
Compose the field notes of Professor Thorne as he dissects the passenger pigeon, his scientific observations mingling with a growing dread.
Write a monologue by Cornelius Lattimore addressed to the portrait of a business rival, explaining why his new palace needs a gallery of extinct birds.
Create the oral story Mato's father tells upon returning from the hunt, describing the 'confused, diminished streams' of the buffalo.
technical: Build an interactive map tracing the routes of the market hunters' telegraph messages and the railroad lines that shipped the barrels of pigeons.
Create a data visualization of the logarithmic decline of the passenger pigeon population against the linear growth of railroad track mileage, 1850-1880.

council: John James Audubon (for the documenting eye that loves what it kills)
Theodore Roosevelt (for the contradictory conservationist and expansionist drive)
Rebecca Harding Davis (for the lens of industrial life and its human/natural cost)
Black Elk (for the perspective of the land as a living, wounded organism)

cover_prompt: A massive, skeletal bison skull, half-submerged in a river of rusted railroad spikes and glistening black crude oil, its hollow eye socket cradling a perfectly preserved but lifeless hummingbird nest, [Detailed Scene & Context: the scene is set at the violent confluence of a pristine, wild forest and an encroaching industrial complex; telegraph wires stretch into the distance like a metallic web, while in the foreground, a ghostly, translucent Union soldier's hand reaches from the soil to touch a single, blood-red feather resting on a surveyor's map, all under a sky that is both a breathtaking sunset and the sooty glow of furnace fires], [Artistic Style & Medium: in the hyper-detailed, symbolic, and hauntingly luminous style of a composite between Thomas Cole's epic American landscapes and Zdzisław Beksiński's dystopian surrealism, rendered as a photorealistic oil painting with etched engraving textures], [Composition & Camera: a dramatic, wide-angle book cover composition, centered on the skull, with a low camera angle looking up to emphasize the monumental scale of the scene, elements of nature and industry clashing at the edges], [Lighting & Color Palette: chiaroscuro lighting with a stark contrast between the gilded, amber light of a dying sun and the cold, electric blue-white glare of arc lamps, palette of tarnished gold, oxidized copper, arterial crimson, iron black, and sickly verdigris], [Quality & Technical Enforcers: masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev].
